member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Application
member.summary: Manages enterprise application definitions, and exposes methods to add, get, and delete enterprise application definitions.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Application.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Application class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Application.AddApplication(Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Application.ApplicationInfo,Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Application.ApplicationField[],Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Application.ApplicationCreationDisposition)
member.summary: Adds or modifies an enterprise application definition.
member.param: An ApplicationField data type that contains the fields of an enterprise application definition. The maximum number of allowed ApplicationField data types is five. You must specify at least one ApplicationField data type.

One of the ApplicationCreationDisposition values that specifies how the enterprise application definition is created: If the enterprise application definition does not exist, it is created regardless of ApplicationCreationDisposition. If the enterprise application definition exists and you specify ApplicationCreationDisposition. Overwrite and the ApplicationType data type is the same, the enterprise application definition is overwritten.
An ApplicationInfo object that specifies the enterprise application definition that is added.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Application.DeleteApplication(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes the enterprise application definition and all associated credentials.
member.param: The name of the enterprise application definition. This is not the enterprise application definition friendly name. If strApplicationName does not exist in the single sign-on database, a SingleSignonException error is thrown. The maximum number of allowed characters is 128.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Application.GetApplication(System.String,Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Application.ApplicationInfo@)
member.summary: Gets the enterprise application definition.
member.param: The name of the enterprise application definition associated with this NT Domain\Group account name. This is not the enterprise application definition friendly name. The string must be at least 1 character and no more than 128 characters long. If strApplicationName parameter does not exist in the single sign-on database, a SingleSignonException error is thrown.
The ApplicationInfo object that contains the enterprise application definition.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Application.GetGroupApplicationGroup(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Gets a Microsoft Windows NT Domain\Group account associated with a group enterprise application definition.
member.param: The name of the enterprise application definition associated with this NT Domain\Group account name. This is not the enterprise application definition friendly name. The maximum number of allowed characters is 128.
The SSO group name.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Application.ApplicationCollection
member.summary: Enumerates the enterprise application definitions.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Application.ApplicationCollection.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ApplicationCollection class.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Application.ApplicationCreationDisposition
member.summary: Indicates whether to create an application or overwrite an existing application.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Application.ApplicationCreationDisposition.CreateNew
member.summary: Creates a new application.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Application.ApplicationCreationDisposition.Overwrite
member.summary: Overwrites an existing application.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Application.ApplicationField
member.summary: Identifies a field in the enterprise application definition.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Application.ApplicationField.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ApplicationField class.
member.param: The application field name. The string must contain at least 1 character and no more than 128 characters.
true if the field is masked; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Application.ApplicationFieldCollection
member.summary: Enumerates the fields of the enterprise application definition.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Application.ApplicationFieldCollection.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ApplicationFieldCollection class.
member.param: String that contains the enterprise application definition. This is not the enterprise application definition friendly name. The string must contain at least 1 character and no more than 128 characters.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Application.ApplicationInfo
member.summary: Identifies an enterprise application definition.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Application.ApplicationInfo.#ctor(System.String,System.String,Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Application.ApplicationType,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ApplicationInfo class.
member.param: The name of the enterprise application definition. The maximum number of allowed characters is 128.
The friendly name of the enterprise application definition. The maximum number of allowed characters is 128.
One of the ApplicationType values that specifies the type of enterprise application definition.
The e-mail contact for the enterprise application definition. The maximum number of allowed characters is 128.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Application.ApplicationInfo.ApplicationFriendlyName
member.summary: Gets the friendly name of the enterprise application definition.
member.returns: The friendly name of the enterprise application definition.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Application.ApplicationInfo.ApplicationName
member.summary: Gets the name of the enterprise application definition.
member.returns: The name of the enterprise application definition.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.Application.ApplicationInfo.ContactName
member.summary: Gets the name of the person identified as the contact for the enterprise application definition.
member.returns: The name of the person identified as the contact for the enterprise application definition.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.ISsoProvider
member.summary: Represents a single sign-on (SSO) provider. Can be implemented to replace the default SSO provider.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.ISsoProvider.GetApplicationDefinitions
member.summary: Gets a list of enterprise application definitions defined for this single sign-on (SSO) provider.
member.returns: An ApplicationInfo object containing the application definitions.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.ISsoProvider.GetApplicationFields(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the credential fields from the enterprise application definition for the specified application.
member.returns: An array of enterprise application definitions.
member.param: The application ID.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.ISsoProvider.GetCredentialManagementURL(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the URL for managing credentials for the specified application.
member.param: The application ID.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.ISsoProvider.GetCredentials(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the single sign-on (SSO) credentials for the specified application identifier.
member.param: The application ID.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.ISsoProvider.GetCredentialsUsingTicket(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the credentials for the specified ticket and the specified application identifier.
member.returns: An object that represents the credentials.
member.param: An application ID.
The access token. The maximum number of allowed characters is 300.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.ISsoProvider.GetCurrentUser
member.summary: Gets the current user from the current HTTP request. If the request is authenticated with Windows authentication, this returns a UPN (user principal name).
member.returns: The current user from the current HTTP request. If the request is authenticated with Windows authentication, this returns a UPN (user principal name).

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.ISsoProvider.GetSsoProviderInfo
member.summary: Returns the provider information.
member.returns: An object that contains the provider information.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.ISsoProvider.GetTicket
member.summary: Returns a ticket that can be used later to retrieve credentials.
member.returns: A string that contains the ticket.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.ISsoProvider.PutIdentityOnRequest(System.Web.Services.Protocols.HttpWebClientProtocol@,System.String)
member.summary: Puts the appropriate identity using the policy of the specified application on the outbound HTTP request.
member.param: An application ID.
The outbound HTTP request.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.ISsoProvider.PutIdentityOnRequestUsingTicket(System.Web.Services.Protocols.HttpWebClientProtocol@,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Puts the appropriate identity using the policy of the specified application on the outbound HTTP request using the ticket.
member.param: An application ID.
The outbound HTTP request.
The access token. The maximum number of allowed characters is 300.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.SingleSignonCredsNotFoundException
member.summary: Represents an exception that is thrown when SharePoint cannot find the requested credentials in the Single Signon database.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.Portal.SingleSignon.SpsSsoProvider
member.summary: Represents the default single sign-on (SSO) provider that is included with Microsoft Office SharePoint Server 2007. It is the Office SharePoint Server 2007 implementation of the ISsoProvider interface.

member.summary: Returns the single sign-on (SSO) credentials for the specified application.
member.returns: Sensitive credentials are not returned. The SSO provider obtains the correct identity for the current user from the current HTTP request.
member.param: An application ID.

member.summary: An attempt was made to add an enterprise application definition.
